intro: Brachyscome discolor, commonly known as the silver everlasting, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant produces small, white to pale blue flowers that are often surrounded by a fringe of white bracts, giving it a delicate appearance. Brachyscome discolor is known for its ability to thrive in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes. Its short lifespan and prolific seed production contribute to its widespread distribution across its native range.
